Detailed Description

A set of semaphores.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef vector<unsigned short> SemaphoreSet::SemValues

Structure used to indicate the initial values of the semaphore set.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

SemaphoreSet::SemaphoreSet ( const string &  pathName,
char  id,
size_t  nSems,
int  initVals[],
bool  ownExternalResources 
)

Creates a semaphore set. If the process is the first one to create a semaphore set with the given path name and id, a new low-level semaphore set will be created and initialized with the given values. If another process has already created a semaphore set with the same path name and id, this semaphore set will be associated with the same low-level resources, and those will not be initialized (i.e: the initVals vector will be ignored.

Parameters:
pathName A path to an existing file.
id An identifier for the semaphore set.
nSems The number of semaphores in the set.
initVals The initial values for each semaphore in the set.
ownExternalResources Whether this SemaphoreSet "owns" the external system resources associated with it. If true, the system resources will be eliminated on SemaphoreSet's destruction.

SemaphoreSet::SemaphoreSet ( const string &  pathName,
char  id,
const SemValues &  initVals,
bool  ownExternalResources 
)

SemaphoreSet::~SemaphoreSet (  ) 

If ownWxternalResources was set to true in construction, destroys the associated external resources associated with the semaphore set.

bool SemaphoreSet::tryWait ( size_t  semIndex  ) 

Returns:
Whether the semaphore count of the semIndex'th semaphore could be decremented by one (i.e: was different than zero).
